headline.main: THE JAPANESE HOMEWARD BOUND.; The Voyage of the Niagara from Batavia to Hong-Kong. Preparations in Japan for the Reception of the Embassy. News of the Fall of Peking Sacking of the Chinese Emperor's Palace The French obtain the Lion's Share of Booty. Special Correspondence of the New-York Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: We steamed away from Batavia on the 10th instant, and crossing the Sea of Java, we passed through the Strait of Gaspar, then up between Sumatra and Borneo, across the Equator again, and so into the China Sea, where we encountered the first puffs of the Northeast Monsoon, which blew fresh in our teeth until our arrival here on the 22d, having made a fair run of eleven days.

docs.snippet: The most notable political item is the recent passage of a law making all promoters of a mob or revolution liable for all damage growing out therefrom to private, municipal or public property. It has been the object of strong censure and complaint...

headline.main: FROM VALPARAISO.; American Shipping and Miscellaneous Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The most notable political item is the recent passage of a law making all promoters of a mob or revolution liable for all damage growing out therefrom to private, municipal or public property. It has been the object of strong censure and complaint from some persons writing for the Press. It has just been promulgated.

docs.snippet: The mails by the Canada, whose arrival at Boston has been announced, reached this City yesterday morning.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE CANADA'S MAILS; England and France Summon Francis II, to leave Gaeta. IMPORTANT DETAILS FROM CHINA. Graphic Account of the Sack of the Imperial Palace.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mails by the Canada, whose arrival at Boston has been announced, reached this City yesterday morning.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN HAVANA.; The Slaver Sunny South Significant Order of the Spanish Authorities Yellow Fever. COMMERCIAL.

docs.snippet: THE ACCIDENT ON THE STEAMER COMMONWEALTH.--Coroner SCHIEMER yesterday investigated the circumstances attending the death of JAMES MEYERS, a colored youth, employed as a waiter on board the steamer Commonwealth, who died in consequence of scalds...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ACCIDENT ON THE STEAMER COMMONWEALTH.--Coroner SCHIEMER yesterday investigated the circumstances attending the death of JAMES MEYERS, a colored youth, employed as a waiter on board the steamer Commonwealth, who died in consequence of scalds received on Wednesday morning last by the explosion on board that vessel.

docs.snippet: ST. JOHNS, N.F., Friday, Dec. 21. The steamship Fulton, from Southampton, on  the 12th inst., arrived off Cape Race at 5 o'clock this morning, where she was intercepted by the news yacht of the Associated Press.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; THE FULTON OFF CAPE RACE. $600,000 IN SPECIE ON FREIGHT. Confirmation of the News of the Fall of Peking. The Flight of the Chinese Emperor and his Army. SACKING OF THE EMPEROR'S PALACE. VICTOR EMANUEL AT NAPLES.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. JOHNS, N.F., Friday, Dec. 21. The steamship Fulton, from Southampton, on the 12th inst., arrived off Cape Race at 5 o'clock this morning, where she was intercepted by the news yacht of the Associated Press.
